page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area we are covering is several miles due east of{Hereford}and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book of 1086. It is now predominantly a{farming {area,}famous for its hops. The main physical features are Shucknall hill & Backbury hill, which dominate the low- lying Frome valley which holds the most fertile farming land. There are 5 main villages: Bartestree ,Weston Beggard,Shucknall,Dormington & Withington, all lying on the slopes of the various hills around the river. Many buildings are old timber or "black and white" houses, but the area of modern building is increasing. There are 4 main agriculture types: hops,cider apples,grass & winter barley and a few small local industries.
